headline: Research Reveals Shocking Correlation Between Obvious Things And Other Obvious Things
opening_paragraph: Scientists were shocked to discover that water is, in fact, wet, according to a five-year study that cost approximately $3.2 million. The findings, published in a prestigious journal, have important implications for our understanding of things we already understood.
body_paragraphs: The five-year study followed 10,000 participants, 87% of whom were included in at least one study during the research period.
Researchers noted that participants who read the most studies were 300% more likely to be cited in subsequent studies about people who read studies.
The scientific community has hailed the findings as 'revolutionary' and 'obvious,' with calls for additional funding to study why studies require so much funding.
